name: Bachelor of Science in Global Business and Marketing (Double Major)

requirements.name: I. Core Curriculum Requirements: 42 semester credit hours3

options.description: Select any 6 semester credit hours from Communication Core courses (see advisor)
Or select any 3 semester credit hours from Mathematics Core courses (see advisor)
Select any 6 semester credit hours from Life and Physical Sciences Core courses (see advisor and degree requirements)
Select any 3 semester credit hours from Language, Philosophy and Culture Core courses (see advisor)
Select any 3 semester credit hours from Creative Arts Core courses (see advisor)
Select any 6 semester credit hours from American History Core courses (see advisor)
Or select any 6 semester credit hours from Government/Political Science Core courses (see advisor)

courses.description: Or select any 3 semester credit hours from Social and Behavioral Sciences Core courses (see advisor)
Or select any 6 semester credit hours from Component Area Option Core courses (see advisor)

requirements.name: II. Major Requirements: 81 semester credit hours

options.description: Choose 4 courses from one of the following tracks:
If the language credit is obtained without taking classes, six additional semester credit hours of Free Electives (upper-division or lower-division) can be taken by student.
Students are strongly encouraged to meet with their Program Director every semester to discuss their progress, career interests, and international experiences.

requirements.name: III. Elective Requirements: 5 semester credit hours

options.name: A practicum experience of at least 160 working hours is required; the student has the option of zero to 3 semester credit hours, depending on the particular internship, and preference for additional electives.2
A community engagement experience is required; the student has the option of zero or 3 semester credit hours, depending on the particular experience, and preference for additional electives.

courses.description: or ENTP 4340 Social Sector Entrepreneurship and Community Engagement

options.name: Choose from the following to fulfill remaining Guided Elective semester credit hours:

courses.description: Any Faculty-Led International Study Trip course: IMS 3091, IMS 3092, IMS 3093, IMS 3094, IMS 3095, IMS 3096, IMS 3V91, IMS 3V92, IMS 3V93, IMS 3V94, IMS 3V95, IMS 3V96
